qas.question: Who instigated the 1919 riot that reshaped Popper's political views?
The 1919 riot involving Popper's comrades was part of what larger political move?
Popper's critique of which doctrine has its origins in first-hand observation of communist agitation?
Which historically significant communist activist was associated with the 1919 riots in which some of Popper's friends were killed?
What did the Marxist rioters believe would cause more death and suffering than their own agitation?
What year did the Communists stop a riot from occurring?
What was Popper impressed by in his later years?
How many armed people did the police shoot?
What did Popper associate with noble means?
What did Popper think placed freedom before equality?

context: In his early years Popper was impressed by <b6_0>Marxism<b6_0/>, whether of Communists or socialists. An event that happened in <b5_0>1919<b5_0/> had a profound effect on him: During a riot, caused by the <a0_0>Communists<a0_0/>, the police shot <b7_0>several<b7_0/> unarmed people, including some of Popper's friends, when they tried to free party comrades from prison. The riot had, in fact, been part of a plan by which leaders of the Communist party with connections to <a3_0>Béla Kun<a3_0/> tried to take power by <a1_0>a coup<a1_0/>; Popper did not know about this at that time. However, he knew that the riot instigators were swayed by the Marxist doctrine that <a4_0>class struggle<a4_0/> would produce vastly more dead men than the inevitable revolution brought about as quickly as possible, and so had no scruples to put the life of the rioters at risk to achieve their selfish goal of becoming the future leaders of the working class. This was the start of his later criticism of <a2_0>historicism<a2_0/>. Popper began to reject <b8_0>Marxist historicism<b8_0/>, which he associated with questionable means, and later <b9_0>socialism<b9_0/>, which he associated with placing equality before freedom (to the possible disadvantage of equality).
